selrach.bnetbuilder.model.variable
Class RandomVariable

java.lang.Object
  selrach.bnetbuilder.model.variable.RandomVariable
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<RandomVariable>
Direct Known Subclasses:
ContinuousVariable, DiscreteVariable
public abstract class RandomVariable
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<RandomVariable>

Represents the generic commonalities between the different types of variables in the network. Essentially it embodies the connectivity as well as some additional metadata

Author:
Charles Robertson
See Also:
Serialized Form

getCpd

public ConditionalDistribution getCpd(int timeslice)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
This returns the distribution for the desired timeslice, it is assumed that if we query for a higher timeslice than the ones that we have stored, we want the latest timeslice available. It will also generate a default cpd if a cpd is requested and there are currently no cpds defined

Parameters:
timeslice -
Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

setCpd

public void setCpd(ConditionalDistribution cpd,
                   int timeslice)
This adds a different distribution at the given timeslice, note that the minimal amount of cpds to describe the entire timeflow should be put in here. For example, if we are describing a 2-DBN, then there should be 2 cpds for each variable that relies on a prior timestep and 1 cpd for each variable that is independent in time. At timeslice 0, there are only intraslice dependencies, for each additional timeslice, you can only have dependencies from previous timeslices. So, inherantly cpds get "bigger" as they get higher in time.

Parameters:
cpd -
timeslice -

clearCpd

public void clearCpd(int time)

getNumberPotentialCpds

public int getNumberPotentialCpds()
This is the number of potential distributions - 1 that this variable can have associated with it, it is equal to the number of slices back that we potential have to look

Returns:

getParents

public java.util.List<RandomVariable> getParents(int timeslice)
Return all the parents of a particular timeslice, includes interdependencies Parents are stored temporally, so intratimeslice variables come before intertimeslice variables

Parameters:
timeslice -

removeParent

public void removeParent(RandomVariable parent,
                         int timeslice)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
Removing a parent invalidates the cpd for the time that parent existed in and all following times because one of our dependencies has left. We don't regenerate anything CPD-wise, we rely on the model to set our CPDs up again to get to a consistent state

Parameters:
parent -
timeslice -
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
